question.text: The electrostatic energy of Z protons uniformly distributed throughout a spherical nucleus of radius R is given by <math><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>Z</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>Z</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> The measured masses of the neutron, <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></math> are 1.008665 u, 1.007825 u, 15.000109 u and 15.003065 u respectively. Given that the radii of both the <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mi> </mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>d</mi><mi> </mi><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></math> nuclei are same, 1u = 931.5 Me V/ <math><msup><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> (c is the speed of light) and <math><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mrow><mi>ϵ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1.44</mn><mi> </mi><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi><mi> </mi><mi>f</mi><mi>m</mi><mo>.</mo></math> Assuming that the difference between the binding energies of <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mi> </mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>d</mi><mi> </mi><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></math> is purely due to the electrostatic energy, the radius of either of the nuclei is <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi> </mi><mi>f</mi><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text:
Electrostatic energy =BEN-BEO
=7MH+8Mn-MN-8MH+7Mn-MO×C2
=-MH+Mn+MO-MNC2
=-1.007825+1.008665+15.003065-15.000109×931.5
=+3.5359 MeV
∆E=35×1.44×8×7R-35×1.44×7×6R=3.5359
R=3×1.44×145×3.5359=3.42 fm
